Detailed Description

Base class for all C++ implementations.

The abstract class containing the inputs, definitions, and some debugging methods for the Cowichan problems.

Member Function Documentation

void Cowichan::chain ( bool  use_randmat,
bool  use_thresh 
) [private]

Runs the cowichan problem set, chained together. The order in the chain is:

  1. Cowichan::randmat or Cowichan::mandel
  2. Cowichan::half
  3. Cowichan::invperc or Cowichan::thresh
  4. Cowichan::life
  5. Cowichan::winnow
  6. Cowichan::norm
  7. Cowichan::hull
  8. Cowichan::outer
  9. Cowichan::gauss
  10. Cowichan::sor
  11. Cowichan::product (for gauss)
  12. Cowichan::product (for sor)
  13. Cowichan::vecdiff
Parameters:
use_randmat in step 1 use: randmat (if true) or mandel (if false).
use_thresh in step 3 use: thresh (if true) or invperc (if false).

Reimplemented in CowichanLinuxTuples.

void Cowichan::main ( int  argc,
char *  argv[],
bool  use_randmat,
bool  use_thresh 
)

Runs cowichan problems based on command line input. Problem name can be specified on the command line. Otherwise, the chained version is run.

See also:
Cowichan::chain
Parameters:
argc number of command line arguments.
argv command line arguments.
use_randmat passed to chain if chained version is used.
use_thresh passed to chain if chained version is used.
